title: Everything
description: Channel Description

title: Roy Moore Was Banned from the Mall but Won His Defamation Suit
description: A jury in Alabama awarded the former Senate candidate more than eight million dollars. A lawyer for the defense says that the case reflects a worrying trend.
media:keywords: Alabama, Roy Moore, Pedophilia, Lawsuits, Libel, Freedom of the Press
dc:creator: Charles Bethea

title: Daily Cartoon: Tuesday, October 11th
description: “We find the defendant not guilty, compared with you-know-who.”
media:keywords: Cartoons, Humor, Satire, Juries, Not Guilty, Guilty
dc:creator: Julia Suits

title: Carrie Bradshaw Writes Her Column While Trapped in a Corn Maze
description: Women in their thirties have to be more realistic about love. Women in their thirties also have to be more realistic about their ability to finish a corn maze.
media:keywords: Humor, Satire, Sex and the City, Corn, Mazes, Fall
dc:creator: Maeve Dunigan

title: The Vices and Virtues of the Problematic-Male Confessional
description: A strange new entry to the genre is “Predator,” an obsessive meditation on the 1987 Arnold Schwarzenegger blockbuster.
media:keywords: Authors, Books, Predator, Denis Johnson, Raymond Carver, Masculinity
dc:creator: Jay Caspian Kang

title: A Man Who Loved Rattlesnakes
description: Eugene DeLeon liked that he was doing something helpful in town.
media:keywords: Postscript, Texas, Snakes, Reptiles
dc:creator: Susan Orlean

title: Herschel Walker Categorically Denies Ever Playing Football
description: “And I will sue anyone who claims that I did,” Walker declared.
category: Humor / Satire from The Borowitz Report
media:keywords: Satire, Humor, Football, Senate, Republicans
dc:creator: Andy Borowitz

title: “Amsterdam” Is an Exemplary Work of Resistance Cinema
description: Like the best of Chaplin’s work, David O. Russell’s star-crammed historical fantasy brims with both exuberance and rage.
media:keywords: Film, Reviews, David O. Russell, Christian Bale, Margot Robbie, The Thirties, Conspiracies
dc:creator: Richard Brody

title: Major Decisions Ahead for the Supreme Court
description: David Remnick and Jeannie Suk Gersen discuss the cases that will be heard in the Court’s new term.
media:keywords: Podcasts, Politics, Supreme Court, Conservatism

title: Some Superhero Origin Stories
description: “What about you, Batman?”
media:keywords: Humor, Satire, Illustrations, Spider-Man, Superman, Batman, Superheroes
dc:creator: Eddie Ward

title: Kyiv’s Peace Is Destroyed
description: After repelling Russia’s assault earlier this year, the city awakens to missile strikes.
media:keywords: Ukraine, War, Russia, Attack, Missiles
dc:creator: Luke Mogelson

title: Using Distance to Fight Addiction and Estrangement
description: An Indigenous Canadian’s unlikely journey to becoming an ultramarathoner, in Amar Chebib’s documentary short “The Runner.”
media:keywords: Video, Documentary, Running, Addiction, Indigenous People, Canada

title: Daily Cartoon: Monday, October 10th
description: “Your acne is caused by stress, so I recommend reversing climate change, Supreme Court decisions, and the increasing cost of living. Or use ointment.”
media:keywords: Cartoons, Humor, Satire, Acne, Stress, Skin
dc:creator: Mads Horwath

title: The Bel-Canto Brilliance of Lawrence Brownlee
description: The singer’s performance in Rossini’s “Otello,” at Opera Philadelphia, was a tour de force of tenor genius.
dc:creator: Alex Ross

title: Briefly Noted Book Reviews
description: “Marigold and Rose,” “The Slowworm’s Song,” “Bridge to the Sun,” and “The Chaos Machine.”

title: Invasion of the Sports Cheaters!
description: As Aaron Judge broke Roger Maris’s home-run record, weird vibes sullied professional chess and poker, and an angling tournament looked to be the target of a low-tech con: lead weights in the fish.
dc:creator: Ben McGrath

title: The People vs. Palm Trees
description: The landscape designer Lily Kwong wants to replace L.A.’s exotic plants with native species, which require less water and satisfy the allergy constraints of her husband, Nick Kroll.
dc:creator: Sheila Yasmin Marikar

title: The Mail
description: Letters respond to Jonathan Blitzer’s article about Nayib Bukele, the President of El Salvador, and Adam Gopnik’s review of two recent books about democracy.

title: Helicopter Parents Are Last Year’s Model
description: Aggressive but not really effective at cleaning up your kid’s messes? You’re a Leaf-Blower Parent. Quiet but sanctimonious? Tesla Parent, for sure.
dc:creator: Jay Martel

title: Ruben Östlund’s Cruise to Nowhere, with Bubbly
description: The Swedish director of “Triangle of Sadness” set sail from New York Harbor with two of his actors, Dolly De Leon and Zlatko Burić, to talk about seasickness and class warfare.
dc:creator: Michael Schulman

title: Chris Ware’s “Lockdown”
description: The artist discusses using his daily life in his drawings, and his daughter’s experience with school-shooting drills.
media:keywords: Covers, Illustrations, Chris Ware, School Shootings, Disable Inline Signup Unit
dc:creator: Françoise Mouly

title: When the Hindu Right Came for Bollywood
description: The industry used to honor India’s secular ideals—but, since the rise of Narendra Modi, it’s been flooded with stock Hindu heroes and Muslim villains.
dc:creator: Samanth Subramanian

title: The Science and Emotions of Lincoln Center’s New Sound
description: In renovating Geffen Hall, the acoustics came first.
dc:creator: Rivka Galchen

title: Recipes from the Survivors of Auschwitz
description: Survivors of the Holocaust meet up to launch a cookbook—recipes for matzo-ball soup, kogel mogel, and Marion Wiesel’s onionless latkes, favored by her husband, Elie.
dc:creator: Hannah Goldfield

title: Alessandro Manzoni’s “The Betrothed,” Reconsidered
description: Henry James decried the nineteenth century’s “loose baggy monsters,” but a new translation of Alessandro Manzoni’s “The Betrothed” demonstrates the genre’s power.
dc:creator: Joan Acocella

title: “Come Softly to Me,” by David Gilbert
description: “Now we are dead. Don’t ask us how we are dead, we are just dead.”
dc:creator: David Gilbert

title: Waiting for the School Bus in Uvalde
description: After a horrific shooting, a morning ritual takes on new meaning.

title: David Gilbert Reads “Come Softly to Me”
description: The author reads his story from the October 17, 2022, issue of the magazine.
media:keywords: Short Stories, Authors, Podcasts, Literature, Fiction

title: Slide Show: New Yorker Cartoons October 17, 2022
description: New cartoons from the magazine.

title: The Story They Don’t Tell You About Mary’s Little Lamb
description: A song my son and I sang to his kid.
dc:creator: Roz Chast

title: David Gilbert on Finding Stories in Dreams
description: The author discusses “Come Softly to Me,” his story from the latest issue of the magazine.
media:keywords: Short Stories, Literature, Interviews, Fiction, Disable Inline Signup Unit, Dreams, Send notifications on next schedule
dc:creator: Cressida Leyshon

title: The Post-Roe Abortion Underground
description: A multigenerational network of activists is getting abortion pills across the Mexican border to Americans.
dc:creator: Stephania Taladrid

title: The Secret Erotic Drawings of Duncan Grant
description: For decades, the Bloomsbury-group artist quietly sketched his male lovers. These works, long kept hidden by the friends who inherited them, are finally going on display.
media:keywords: Art, LGBTQ, Bloomsbury, Exhibitions, Erotic, Drawings
dc:creator: Anna Russell

title: “Romantic Poetry,” by Diane Seuss
description: Poetry by Diane Seuss: “I was twenty-three when I sold off / ‘Modern Poetry’ and sailed to Italy.”
dc:creator: Diane Seuss

title: “Before Notre Dame Burned, We Went on Vacation,” by Maya Phillips
description: Poetry by Maya Phillips: “My god was a private shame.”
dc:creator: Maya Phillips

title: Lydia Millet’s Post-Human Prose
description: In “Dinosaurs,” Millet once again rejects the small, familiar world of the individual. Her subject is loss on a planetary scale.
dc:creator: Katy Waldman

title: The Long March Toward a National Latino Museum
description: A community whose role in U.S. history has been too often ignored is telling its story at the Smithsonian.
media:keywords: Latinos, Smithsonian, Civil Rights, Museums, American History
dc:creator: Graciela Mochkofsky

title: Cartoon Caption Contest
description: Submit your caption.

title: Annie Ernaux’s Justly Deserved Nobel
description: Her win marks the ascendancy of the memoir as the leading genre of our time.
media:keywords: Writers, Literature, Memoir, Memoirs, France, Nobel Prize in Literature
dc:creator: Adam Gopnik

title: The War in Ukraine Launches a New Battle for the Russian Soul
description: The last time people were writing in Russian so urgently was in the late nineteen-eighties, when Soviet citizens were confronted with the terror of the Stalinist past.
dc:creator: Masha Gessen

title: The Cryptic Crossword: Sunday, October 9, 2022
description: Wow . . . getting no inheritance (4).
media:keywords: Cryptic Crossword, Crossword, Puzzles, Puzzles & Games
dc:creator: Neville Fogarty

title: What Your First-Date Clothing Says About You
description: Looking for a long-term commitment? Anticipating the need to sprint? Dress accordingly.
media:keywords: Humor, Satire, Fashion, Dating, Style
dc:creator: Sarah Kempa, Sara K. Runnels

title: Iran’s Protests Are the First Counter-Revolution Led by Women
description: Women are still defying and dying in an uprising that is historically unique for being centered on women’s freedom.
media:keywords: Iran, Protests, Women, Gender, Hijab, Revolutions
dc:creator: Robin Wright

title: Eileen Fisher Meditates on What’s Next
description: The doyenne of elegant, comfortable, timeless clothes talks about hiring a C.E.O. for her eponymous company, her design philosophy, and being profiled by Janet Malcolm.
media:keywords: Designers, Fashion, Minimalism, Sustainability, Environmentalism
dc:creator: Carrie Battan

title: María Irene Fornés and the Garden of Our Potential
description: “Mud” and “Drowning,”two plays directed by JoAnne Akalaitis, with new music by Philip Glass, probe humanity’s desire for knowledge.
media:keywords: Theatre, Education, Literacy, Culture, Philip Glass
dc:creator: Vinson Cunningham

title: How Many Times Will You Get COVID?
description: When it comes to coronavirus infections, the third time is not the charm. What is?
media:keywords: Coronavirus, Covid-19, Pandemic, Omicron, Delta variant, Vaccines
dc:creator: Dhruv Khullar

title: My Kid’s the One in the Harvard Tee
description: Judging by your child’s tee, he’s pinning his future less on a top-tier education and more on dinosaurs riding surfboards.
media:keywords: Humor, Satire, Harvard, Parents
dc:creator: Jeremy Hooper

title: America: Pro or Con?
description: Debate and democracy in “1776” and “Baldwin and Buckley at Cambridge.”
media:keywords: Founding Fathers, Racism, Sexism, James Baldwin, Off Broadway, Broadway Musicals, Playwrights
dc:creator: Helen Shaw

title: Biden Heads for the Midterms with Ten Million New Jobs
description: Inflation is still a cause for concern, but no other President has had this pace of job growth in their first two years in office.
media:keywords: Economy, Jobs, Inflation, Wall Street, Joe Biden
dc:creator: John Cassidy

title: At Eighty-five, Tom Stoppard Faces His Past
description: The legendary playwright is out with a new play, reflecting on his family’s history in the Holocaust. Plus, the contributor Jeannie Suk Gersen on what’s next for the Supreme Court.
category: Podcast / The New Yorker Radio Hour
media:keywords: Podcasts, David Remnick, Broadway, Theater, Playwrights, The Holocaust, Supreme Court, Abortion, Geena Davis, Memoir

title: Two Portraits of the Power and Menace of Image-Making, at the New York Film Festival
description: A pair of the strongest entries at this year’s festival spotlight brilliant artists at work: Jafar Panahi and Thelonious Monk.
media:keywords: Film, Reviews, New York Film Festival, Movies, Jafar Panahi, Thelonious Monk, Documentaries
dc:creator: Richard Brody
